divs: sighting detailswitnesses were in a six-seat airplane, flying from pella, ia to minneapolis, mn. the three witnesses were seated on the right side of the airplane. wit a was in copilot seat, wit b in rear, wit c was between them. two sightings occurred. sighting 1: witnesses were wita and witc. occurred at about 7:30 pm. flying due north, 20 miles south of hampton, ia. altitude was 3700 ft, level, airspeed 140mph approaching hampton for refueling. wit a attention caught by glint of metalic object at 12 o'clock low. wit a est that object was 400 ft away, 300 ft below. object was moving on n to s path, antiparallel with aircraft. wit a est that it took less than 3 seconds to move 3 miles as measured against section lines on iowa farm fields object was round and shiny. there was a red light or lens on the top of it. size was approximately that of a quarter at arm's length. wit a turned head to follow object. gone in a second, lost to sight behind head of person sitting behind. last seen at 5 o'clock low. wit b also saw object, but i do not yet have his report. sighting 2 - 8:00 pm - 2 seconds in length: witnessed by all three wits. airplane flying from hampton iowa toward minneapolis. wit b first saw the object (do not yet have his report) wit a heard wit b 'squeal'. turned to look back and saw object in rear window of airplane. all 3 wits observed object in rear window, receding rapidly into distance until lost from sight. object was primarily visible as a red light against the darker ground. wit a says that metalic\reflective surface associated with light. wit b says that only light was visible.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Hampton
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: 2006 Iowa flyby of object past aircraft - two sightings during flight
